item.title: Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Survivor launches February 18, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Smartphone

Pre-registration now available.

Free-to-play survivor action game Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Survivor will launch for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play on February 18, 2026, publisher Bushiroad Games announced. Pre-registration is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Hunter x Hunter new survivor action! Hunter x Hunter: Nen x Survivor!

A roguelike experience where you mow down waves of enemies with Nen ability. Use random skills and party synergy to build a different build every time!

Key Features

  • Survivor x Action x Roguelike: Intense Nen ability action in short bursts.
  • Simple, intuitive gameplay optimized for one-hand control.
  • Auto mode ensures steady progress, even when you’re short on time.
  • Infinite builds through “Skills” x “Party” x “Strategy.”
  • Favorite Hunter x Hunter characters appear: Gon, Killua, Hisoka, and more.
  • Multiple difficulty levels and stages for deep replayability.

Recommended for Players Who…

  • Love Hunter x Hunter.
  • Fans of survival games, roguelikes, and skill-building.
  • Looking for a thrilling action game playable with one hand.
  • Love diving deep into roguelike action games.

Hone your “Nen” and aim for the ultimate peak!

Watch a new trailer below.

Jump Festa 2026 Special Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/hunter-x-hunter-nen-x-survivor-launches-february-18-2026

item.title: DAVE THE DIVER DLC ‘In the Jungle’ details new village, restaurant, and gameplay systems
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

10-hour-long expansion due out in early 2026.

MINTROCKET has released a new “Developer Dive” video for DAVE THE DIVER, reflecting on 2025 and sharing studio updates, including a deep dive of information on the downloadable content “In the Jungle,” which is due out in early 2026.

Here are the details:

■ Downloadable Content “In the Jungle”

Following the gameplay sneak peek as part of November’s Xbox Partner Preview, Mintrocket reveals that the next downloadable content—the largest story expansion yet—will launch with approximately 10 hours of content. Much of this new adventure introduces fresh, surprising mechanics and systems that branch boldly away from the base game and previous downloadable contents.

In “In the Jungle,” Dave heads into freshwater as he embraces new responsibilities and challenges, including befriending the locals of his and a friend’s new home base: a quaint jungle village brimming with opportunity… and just a splash of danger.

The Village

Welcome to Utara, a jungle village where time flows in real-time. Here, Dave can spend his days freely diving underwater, gathering fruits and resources—and, naturally, building relationships with the locals by completing tasks and side quests.

As ever, Dave finds himself surrounded by potential friends (and future customers) whose trust and patronage must be earned. As relationships deepen, so too do the rewards, unlocking new opportunities throughout Utara and creating ripple effects that extend all the way to Bancho’s restaurant business.

The Restaurant

One of “In the Jungle’s” biggest departures from the base game is the introduction of Bancho Grill, a brand-new restaurant in Utara featuring a fully cooked freshwater menu.

Unlike Bancho Sushi, where movement was limited, Dave can now move freely throughout the Grill, serving customers across multiple areas rather than a single horizontal plane. As Dave’s bonds with villagers grow, they’ll begin visiting Bancho Grill as diners, making the restaurant a key hub, and a vital link, between Dave and the village community.

Systems and Mechanics

This time around, Dave dives into a massive freshwater lake instead of the Blue Hole—one packed with new aquatic life, unexpected cuisine options, and plenty of lurking danger. New waters demand new tools, and Mintrocket revealed Dave’s latest piece of gear: the Jungle Gun. This versatile weapon can freely transform into net guns, shotguns, snipers, or regular guns, allowing Dave to adapt on the fly and giving players the freedom to experiment with their preferred combat styles.

Combined with a shift from fully horizontal movement to a more free-flowing isometric view, along with real-time progression, Dave will need to carefully balance priorities and make smarter use of space and time. Expect new minigames with friends, jungle-specific adventures, and a wide variety of activities that benefit Bancho Grill, or Utara as a whole.

■ DAVE THE DIVER Mobile

Rounding out today’s Dev Dive, Mintrocket also revealed plans to complete Dave’s multi-platform expedition by bringing the game to mobile platforms together with a partner. DAVE THE DIVER on mobile won’t be a simple port—instead, the game will be fully optimized and redesigned to perform seamlessly on mobile. One example shared in the vlog is the ability to tilt mobile devices to pour tea. DAVE THE DIVER will launch on mobile devices first in China, and globally thereafter later in 2026.

DAVE THE DIVER is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

Watch the latest “Developer Dive” video below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Developer Dive: Latest “In the Jungle” News, 2025 Recaps, and More!

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/dave-the-diver-dlc-in-the-jungle-details-new-village-restaurant-and-gameplay-systems

item.title: PATAPON 1+2 REPLAY new game mode update launches December 22
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Details to be announced.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer SAS have will release a free update for PATAPON 1+2 REPLAY on December 22, which adds a brand-new game mode, the companies announced.

Information about the new game mode was not shared, but details are planned to be announced in the coming days.

PATAPON 1+2 REPLAY is available now for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a teaser trailer below.

Free Update Teaser Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/patapon-12-replay-new-game-mode-update-launches-december-22

item.title: The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon ‘Story’ and ‘Battle’ demos now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Carry over your save data to the full game when it launches.

“Story” and “Battle” demos for The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon, publisher NIS America announced.

The “Story” demo, which features an introduction through the game’s prologue, is available for PlayStation 5, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam. The “Battle” demo, which is packed with combat, is available for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4.

Here is an overview of each demo, via NIS America:

Story Demo

Play through the Prologue of The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon! Van Arkride and Arkride Solutions return as the fate of the entire Zemurian continent hangs in the balance. With Zemuria preparing for its first space venture, Van Arkride, Rean Schwarzer, and Father Kevin Graham are called to a Marduk training exercise that sets them on a collision course with the secrets at the heart of the world. Their paths may diverge, but the ultimate question remains the same: Just what lies beyond the edge of the horizon?

The Story Demo is available now on PC, Nintendo Switch*, Nintendo Switch 2*, PlayStation 4, and PlayStation 5.

*All save data will carry over to the main game upon release with the day one patch.

Battle Demo

Battle in the Grim Garten! Choose from three party selections (Van, Kevin, and Rean) and take on the Grim Garten, a virtual reality service originally developed by Marduk that has since been hacked by Ouroboros, who altered both its appearance and functionalities. Its earlier version, the ‘Marchen Garten,’ was considered the world’s first fully immersive virtual reality service and had the ability to connect users across the continent through the power of the orbal network.

The Battle Demo is exclusively available now on PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5.

The Legend of Heroes: Trails beyond the Horizon is due out for PlayStation 5, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG on January 15, 2026 in the west. It first launched for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 on September 26, 2024 in Japan and Asia, followed by PC via Steam on January 23, 2025 in Asia.

Watch a new trailer below.

Demos Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/the-legend-of-heroes-trails-beyond-the-horizon-story-and-battle-demos-now-available
